Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: I had two instructors and they both did a wonderful job leading the groups, providing guidance and spiritual understanding. I wish we had had more time for the group interaction.
Lainie and Donna were two instructors that I met with.

I think it would have been a more meaningful experience for me if we had stayed in the same group the whole time instead of switching right as I felt we were building a trusting community for discussing our experience with the exercises

Dr Ruffing
another lady who's name I forget
The strength is the emphasis on spirituality, and the weakness is probably the same thing. Everything sounded very vague and confusing up to halfway through the course.
Both were knowledgeable, interested, patient. Both were very good facilitators.

She was excellent and reflecting the interior movements of students. She was great at asking productive questions that didn't lead us in a specific direction, but made space for students to do more reflection on their consolations.

Their position was constantly undermined by Prof. Ruffing and they had no power to support students. They violated confidentiality by sharing the content of spiritual direction groups with Prof. Ruffing.
